content.en: Subsurface modeling: Scientists are exploring the use of algorithms to generate models of the subsurface and improve the interpretation of data in various geophysical applications. While the agency attributed to the algorithms is not specified in most cases, the Idaho National Laboratory (INEL) is mentioned as the agency behind a three-dimensional inversion algorithm. These algorithms have the potential to enhance our understanding of complex resistivity, induced polarization, and conductivity in the Earth's subsurface, which can have important implications for engineering, environmental, and resource exploration purposes.
content.da: Subsurface-modellering: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer til at generere modeller af subsurface og forbedre fortolkningen af data i forskellige geofysiske anvendelser. Selvom den agentur, der tilskrives algoritmerne, ikke er specificeret i de fleste tilfælde, nævnes Idaho National Laboratory (INEL) som agenturet bag en tredimensionel inversionsalgoritme. Disse algoritmer har potentiale til at forbedre vores forståelse af kompleks resistivitet, induceret polarisering og konduktivitet i Jordens subsurface, hvilket kan have vigtige implikationer for ingeniørarbejde, miljø- og ressourceudforskning.
